decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield as soon as possible. Once Primeval Titan is out, the goal is to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with a bunch of Mountains to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent. Karn, the Great Creator is included to provide additional utility and disruption for the opponent. The deck also includes various lands to ensure consistent mana production and protection from opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive play, aiming to burn through the opponent's life total quickly. It includes a mix of efficient burn spells, cheap creatures with haste, and powerful enchantments that punish the opponent for casting spells. The mana base is optimized for consistent colored mana sources to cast spells early and consistently. Overall, the goal is to apply pressure early, use burn spells to finish off the opponent, and prevent the opponent from stabilizing or gaining life.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and controlling the game through countering spells and removal effects. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with Urza, Lord High Artificer and generate card advantage with Mishra's Bauble and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to gain advantage and close out the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans while building up your own resources to ensure victory through a combination of control and powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize graveyard mechanics, such as Dredge, to quickly fill the graveyard and bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By consistently dredging cards and discarding others with cards like Cathartic Reunion, the deck can quickly build a formidable board presence. Additionally, cards like Ox of Agonas and Creeping Chill provide additional value and reach, while Life from the Loam ensures a steady stream of resources. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its graveyard synergies and explosive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Death's Shadow as a powerful aggro threat by manipulating your own life total through cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Tidehollow Sculler while also providing additional utility with Ranger-Captain of Eos and Kolaghan's Command. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board. Overall, this deck focuses on efficiently using resources and maximizing the power of Death's Shadow to overpower the opponent quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, as well as direct damage spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient damage output, while also utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack to disrupt their game plan. The mana base consists of mostly red sources to ensure consistency in casting spells and maximizing damage potential.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana, allowing the player to cast powerful colorless threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and other Eldrazi creatures. It also includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Expedition Map to help find the necessary Tron lands, as well as control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on filling its graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Life from the Loam. By constantly dredging cards and bringing them back from the graveyard, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures. Cards like Creeping Chill provide direct damage to the opponent, while Conflagrate can finish off the game by dealing damage based on the number of cards in the graveyard. The key strategy is to constantly fill and utilize the graveyard to create a powerful board presence and win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Aggro strategy with Death's Shadow as the key card. The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly by playing low-cost high-power creatures like Tarmogoyf and Death's Shadow. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek allows for disruption of the opponent's game plan, while cards like Stubborn Denial provide protection for your own creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald to search for specific cards needed to win the game.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with efficient counterspells like Archmage's Charm and Cryptic Command to control the opponent's board and hand. Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide card advantage and tempo plays, while cards like Path to Exile and Force of Negation help handle threats efficiently. The deck also utilizes a mana base with snow lands and Arcum's Astrolabe to enable a variety of spells and to ensure consistency in mana fixing.

The main concept of this deck is to mill cards into the graveyard with cards like Shriekhorn and self-mill cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug. This strategy enables you to bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard, while also increasing your life total with Creeping Chill. Life from the Loam allows you to continuously return lands from the graveyard to your hand, providing you with additional resources. Conflagrate and Ox of Agonas provide additional reach and card advantage, making this deck a powerful and resilient combo archetype.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, counterspells, and tempo plays. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Remand, and Fact or Fiction, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing into more powerful spells. Wilderness Reclamation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional value and mana ramp, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a turn. The inclusion of Nexus of Fate ensures that the player can take extra turns to further solidify their control over the game.

This deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail. The deck also has access to versatile answers like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable to deal with a variety of threats. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and the Urza lands, the deck can generate a large amount of mana to cast its threats ahead of schedule. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and disruptive spells in order to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing efficient creatures and disruption spells to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. It aims to apply pressure early in the game with threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil. The deck also benefits from the flexibility of cards like Wrenn and Six, providing recurring value and land destruction. Overall, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently in order to secure a fast victory.

The main objective of this deck is to establish control over the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with efficient counterspells like Force of Negation and Cryptic Command. Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide card advantage and board control, while Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict handle opposing threats. The deck also utilizes mana fixing with Arcum's Astrolabe and can generate value with Mystic Sanctuary. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through strong card advantage and control elements.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with Dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Shriekhorn to fuel the graveyard. This allows for trigger abilities on cards like Narcomoeba and Bloodghast, while also setting up for powerful plays with cards like Ox of Agonas and Prized Amalgam. The deck is looking to utilize its graveyard as a resource to generate advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats.

Utilize Eldrazi creatures and powerful colorless spells to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive plays. Use Eldrazi Temple and Urza lands for ramp, while Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's plays. Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher provide efficient threats, supported by removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust. Karn, the Great Creator gives access to versatile artifacts, while Ugin, the Ineffable supports the aggro strategy with card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control with a streamlined Eldrazi creature package.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan to deal massive damage to the opponent's creatures and life total. By utilizing cards like Explore, Search for Tomorrow, and Sakura-Tribe Elder, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production in order to cast its high-impact threats early in the game. The addition of cards like Prismatic Omen and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove helps to ensure that Valakut's trigger ability is consistently active, allowing for devastating bursts of damage.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy with Chalice of the Void. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Ineffable provide additional utility and control options, while Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a game-ending threat. The deck also includes mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Expedition Map to help cast the expensive Eldrazi spells. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and disrupt their game plan with targeted disruption.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary, Goblin Guide, and Wild Nacatl, supported by spells like Lightning Bolt and Atarka's Command for additional reach and removal. The deck also includes cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Hidden Herbalists for explosive starts and Tarmogoyf for additional mid-game threats. Klothys, God of Destiny provides both disruption and a clock against control decks. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with fetch lands and a mix of shock lands and basic lands for color fixing.
